reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not an attractive building but the location is good. Easy access to the highway and easy walk to the historic part of town. Lots of bars and restaurants near by. Organic grocer across the road.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is adequate. Clean and equipped with fridge and micro wave. Comfortable beds and good water pressure in shower. Tea, coffee, etc, available all day from the office.
reviews.title: Comfortable beds and clean rooms

reviews.text: Friendly, helpful staff with directions. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Budget Hotel

reviews.text: The room was a little small, but suited us ok. We had a great night sleep as the beds and pillows were comfy. Microwaves and fridge in the room is nice, but no coffee in the room. The coffee is at the reception desk. The staff at the front desk was friendly.
reviews.title: Spotless and reasonable rates

reviews.text: This clean quiet and friendly hotel is close to everything in Flagstaff. This is not a luxury hotel but perfect for budget minded travelers or those don't use the amenities offered at the much higher priced competitors.The front desk was eager to make recommendations and offer advise to make the most of our stay. The cost to stay Saturday through Monday nights was under $210. A bargain considering the first night was a weekend night. Coffee was served in the lobby and there is a nice assortment of restaurants near by.
reviews.title: Good value for a short stay

reviews.text: We stayed here because of the recommendations on Trip Advisor. We were very pleased. It was EXCEPTIONALLY clean, the staff was friendly, and it was conveniently located in downtown Flagstaff near the North Arizona University and the depot. We felt that we got good value for our money. They do not have breakfast, but we walked across the street to the organic grocery and got breakfast items. We had no problems with noise from Route 66.
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located within walking distance from historic town. Very clean. Although very close to major highways, there was no road noise. The hotel staff was not familiar with the local attractions but that was quickly solved by a trip to the visitor's bureau which was in easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: no pool, no restaurant but that wasn't a problem
reviews.title: Nothing special but nothing wrong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's plenty of choice of motels around the town, I thought we could have got a better deal hunting around. That said there was nothing wrong with the place and the staff were helpful. The room was fine, clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Good choice for a stop over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had caught the train in Chicago and got off at Flagstaff. The motel (classic lay out) was a short taxi ride from the train station. We were very delayed and the guy on the desk stay extra late to check us in. Very efficient checking in. The room was very clean, rather large - not that that is a bad thing - with a large bathroom. We spent a very restful night there - it was very quiet despite being so close to main roads. As a stopping off point to get started in that part of Arizona, it was great and very economical. Very close to the city centre, so we were able to walk into town and to the car hire place to pick up our car and had a great breakfast at the back of the railway station in Biff's Bagels. I would have liked to stay there a couple of days longer.
reviews.title: Great and cheap choice on your way to Grand Canyon

reviews.text: Good choice on a way to/from Grand Canyon.
reviews.title: Simple Clean Good

reviews.text: Clean and comfortable rooms with refrigerator and microwave. Free wi-fi. Laundry room. Free unlimited coffee (brewed and instant), hot chocolate and selection of about 8 different teas in the lobby from 6am to midnight. Two floor motel - easy access from car with luggage.
reviews.title: Clean, Cheap, Nice Location

reviews.text: Very quick and easy check-in/out.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: No pool or breakfast but for early departure to Grand Canyon this is a great choice. Will stay again if in the area.
reviews.title: Cheap, clean room. Hotel snobs, look elsewhere.

reviews.text: Note; from the lobby to the rooms, cleaning staff LOVE Lysol which you can smell everywhere. A bit overpowering at first but no reason not to book this place.
reviews.title: Great Price Great Location Great Rooms

reviews.text: We chose this motel because f the price on booking dot com. We paid 48 US and even though that is without tax, it still was a good price. Rooms are OK and staff are OK. Not overly interested or helpful but not rude either. It's an 8 minute stroll to downtown which has great restaurants and bars. Flagstaff is a great little town because of all the students, it has lots to go for. We tried one of the (3!) Thai restaurants and the Irish pub Collins.
reviews.title: Cheap and clean

reviews.text: I stayed in this motel just one night. The room was very plain and not very attractive. The usual polyester patterned bedspread and matching drapes. Plain. Clean room; carpet was decent. Wireless worked fine. There is a fridge in every room, I believe; in my room, it was set on top of a white wooden structure, kind of tacky. Rooms do not have phones or coffee-makers, but they do have microwaves. I noticed how quiet the room was, in spite of the motel seemingly being pretty full that night, so I think the walls and doors are well-insulated. Desk clerk was polite but did not offer extra info. Bed was firm, and nothing special, but I was able to sleep on it, so it was not uncomfortable. TV is a large tube TV, not HD. All in all, an adequate little space, but nothing pretty, cheerful, or attractive. Oh and great location! Within walking distance of NAU and downtown, right on the main drag, Milton. No pets allowed, btw.
reviews.title: Adequate, plain accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would rate this a 3.5 but that's not an option. We paid $79 before taxes and chose this because we like a fridge/microwave and being within walking distance of bars and restaurants. After getting into town there seemed to be many motels nearby which were similar but the Highland had better reviews. Getting coffee in the lobby was not bad and the room was clean. One complaint is the fan came on with the light in the bathroom and was extremly loud. Fine place if you're just looking for a room.
reviews.title: The pics are exactly what you get

reviews.text: Will certainly stay here again. The owner seems to take really good care of the place. It's only about a mile from downtown so we just walked everywhere from the hotel. It's not fancy but the price is great. The Internet is a little slow and there isn't a coffee maker in the room but you can get coffee from the front desk in the morning. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Very clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and bathroom were spotless. There was plenty of parking. It was quiet at night. And, the motel is located downtown just across the street from NAU. No pool or jacuzzi. No breakfast or adjoining restaurant. Just a straightforward, clean, quiet lodging. I would stay there again without hesitation. Flagstaff motels are pricey during eventful weekends.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, simple
